I think we should catch these exceptions and log out a single line error message possibly just with details like the URL being requested and the type of IO error (e.g. broken pipe, connection reset by peer, etc).  It may be worth still logging the full exception if debug logging is enabled because it's not inconceivable this information might be useful when diagnosing an issue.  (right now the full stack trace as above is printed regardless of if debug logging is enabled)
fields.summary: Fisheye throws exceptions on network interruption

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a new local git branch. Let's call it new_branch.
# Add a commit to this branch.
# Push this branch.
# Wait for FishEye to finish scanning the repository.
# Modify the last commit on the branch (e.g. git commit --amend -m "new message").
# Force-push the branch (git push -f origin new_branch:new_branch).
# Wait for FishEye to finish scanning the repository.
# On the Search tab of the relevant repository, do a search for all revisions on the branch new_branch. You will see both the revision created on step 5 (which is good) and the revision created on step 2 (which is bad, because it is no longer on the branch).

h3.Workaround
Need to reindex the repository
fields.summary: Remove commit that should be gone after force push

Currently, when a custom authentication method is used, the customer can manage users, but is not able to manage groups.

It would be great to have access to the groups information programatically, allowing to create custom authenticators that manage users and groups.

fields.description:
EditRevisionsAjaxAction.execute() adds entries to cru_revision table and then EditRevisionsAjaxAction.addRemoveRepoRev() calls the DefaultContentManager to properly add the revisions to the database, which then executes in a separate thread.

This deadlocks because EditRevisionsAjaxAction.execute() does not commit before calling addRemoveRepoRev, and the work it does executes in a different thread and by extension a different database session.

This is trivially reproducible using MySQL and a LightSCM Subversion repository.  *This behaviour can not be seen when using the HSQL database*

I haven't understood this code well enough to know whether or not it can happen with native repository access as well, but I haven't been able to reproduce it out side of LightSCM.
fields.summary: DefaultContentManager can deadlock in database when reviewing content from a LightSCM repository

fields.description:
*Given*
A user logs in before, but for some reason the session times out.
The user is using Chrome(version 28 which has previews to the website, when opening a new tab)

*When*
The user try to open a new tab in Chrome and quickly type the fisheye home address and hit enter

*Expected*
The user should have no problem logging in because there is a remember me cookie set already from the last login.

*Actual*
The user is forced to log in again.

*Possible cause*
The preview feature from chrome's new tab page tries to load a thumbnail from fisheye which trigger a request to Fisheye with the remember me cookie. This request comes along with the user's request and they cause a racing condition. 

If the chrome's request comes first, the backend will generate a new RND number for the the remember me cookie. However, the user's real request comes to the backend with the old cookie number. That will result in a mismatch.

*Extra notes*
The problem may not only happens in chrome, but in any situation where there are two requests triggered simultaneously after session timeout or expired.
fields.summary: User will have login problem with RememberMe cookie when there is a racing condition

fields.description:
When indexing a Mercurial repository I got the following error:
"NOTE: This repository, Cascade, has more than 10 committers which exceeds the limits for your Starter license. Indexing has stopped.
To fix this you can Evaluate, Upgrade or Reconfigure your repository.
You may also be able to adjust the committer names when a single user has used multiple email addresses. Please refer to this page for more information."

The "Evaluate, Upgrade or Reconfigure your repository." part of this text has a link applied to it which points to the following URI: 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3IIfD

This results in the display of a "Page Not Found" page. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/tinyurl.action?urlIdentifier=3IIfD
fields.summary: Broken Link: http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3IIfD

fields.description: After a SVN branch is deleted, it would help to mark deleted branches in the Commit Graph and unselect them from the graph to simplify the view.
fields.summary: Mark deleted SVN branches in the Commit Graph

fields.description:
Inspired by the Answers post by Stephen Lecheler: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/244310/fisheye-subversion-and-directory-updates-who-what-revision-when?page=1#244473

Investigate the performance impacts of displaying the following three fields for directories, as we currently do for files.
* modified date
* author
* revision id

Investigation already by [~bhumphreys] has revealed that is appears we are already storing these attributes on directory nodes, so the prognosis is good.
fields.summary: Display modified date, author and revision for directory listings in FishEye
Hidden Directory does not work when a hidden dir is a single dir
Error when trying to view file source for a tag

fields.description:
Apparently there is a difference between turning on debug logging via [the command line|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Command-Line+Options] and when it is done [through the GUI|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Contacting+Support].

It would be very helpful to have a detailed description publicly available for the difference. What is apparent is that with the command line option, you can get {{SystemResourceMonitor}} entries in the logs, but there can be others.
fields.summary: Documentation request: debug logging

fields.description:
In FishEye/Crucible changelog view, only the author column has a user info popup.

It would be better to have the revision column to have a popup info on commit message and date as well like TortoiseSVN.
fields.summary: Add revision info popup like user info

fields.description:
Nowadays you need to manually go to System Info and click on "Request Garbage Collection" every time you want to run garbage collection.

As it is possible to request garbage collection, it would be awesome if it were possible to schedule this feature to be executed automatically every X minutes/hours.
fields.summary: Allow scheduled garbage collection

fields.description:
Observed at least in IE10 (but seems to work in Opera): 
The "View" and "Fisheye" menus on the top right of the review screen appear behind the diff text. The feature is therefore unusable. See attached image. 

I recently updated Crucible from 3.1.4 to 3.2.1. It used to work before.
fields.summary: "View" and "Fisheye" menus appear behind text in IE10

fields.description:
There should be a way to expose the FishEye repositories indexing status to people who are not admins.
This is helpful in cases when there is a big commit and it takes FishEye a while to process it and people think it is broken or it slows down.
fields.summary: Allow non-admins to verify repository indexing status

fields.description:
When the number of users in a Starter License is exceeded, the UI will present an error message. This message could be made clearer if either the wording about historical committers is included or perhaps a link to the documentation:
* [Restrictions on FishEye Starter Licenses|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Restrictions+on+FishEye+Starter+Licenses#RestrictionsonFishEyeStarterLicenses-Reconfigureyourrepository]
fields.summary: Add Link to Documentation For the "Committers Exceeded in Starter License" Error in the UI
On Windows, Fisheye attempts to make ssh keys private but appears to be unsucessful

Migration of version 2.6.0 to a newer one (3.1.5) fails with following error:
{noformat}
java.io.IOException: Error talking to database: Problem with constraints script /opt/webservers/fecru-2.6.0_initial/sql/MYSQL/schema/constraints_73.sql

at com.atlassian.crucible.migration.item.DBImporter.importData(DBImporter.java:159)
at com.atlassian.crucible.migration.item.SQLBackup.restore(SQLBackup.java:192)
... 9 more
Caused by: com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruDBException: SQL script error on line 115: "alter table cru_revision add index FKE2F52A1434AAD25A (cru_path), add constraint FKE2F52A1434AAD25A foreign key (cru_path) references cru_stored_path (cru_path_id);"
(Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`sources_RC1`.`#sql-1b16_1142`, CONSTRAINT `FKE2F52A1434AAD25A` FOREIGN KEY (`cru_path`) REFERENCES `cru_stored_path` (`cru_path_id`))), please contact http://www.atlassian.com/support/
at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:484)
at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:415)
at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.addConstraints(DefaultDBControl.java:312)
... 11 more
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`sources_RC1`.`#sql-1b16_1142`, CONSTRAINT `FKE2F52A1434AAD25A` FOREIGN KEY (`cru_path`) REFERENCES `cru_stored_path` (`cru_path_id`))
at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)

at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:513)

at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1038)

at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3495)
at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:1959)
at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2113)
at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2687)
at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1647)

at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:456)
... 13 more
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
It is caused by inconsistency between {{cru_revision}} and {{cru_path}} tables which can be fixed using SQL statements:
{code}
delete from cru_revision where cru_path not in (select cru_path_id from cru_stored_path);
delete from cru_fr_detail where cru_revision_id not in (select cru_revision_id from cru_revision);
{code}
fields.summary: Failing migration from Crucible with FishEye v2.6.0 -> 3.1.5

fields.description:
In all other Atlassian products the *_HOME folder is the data location, but FishEye is the odd one out, this is very confusing.

I would like to see this corrected and being aligned with the other products so that FISHEYE_HOME points to the location of the data and not to the location of the binary files.
fields.summary: FISHEYE_HOME/FISHEYE_INST environment variables are confusing and not inline with other products

fields.description:
Switching ON Debug Logging in administration section (/admin/viewServerSettings.do) doesn't work for plugins. Plugins use different loggers than the main application.

Proposed loggers to be included in switching ON Debug Logging:
* com.atlassian.fecru
* com.atlassian.crucible
* com.atlassian.fisheye
fields.summary: Debug Logging toggle doesn't work for plugins

fields.description: We should provide a system property {{fisheye.index.mergefactor}} that allows a user to change the merge factor used by Lucene (to change the tradeoff between ram/fd usage, indexing and querying speed).
fields.summary: provide a system property to change the lucene merge factor

fields.description:
Dear Support Team,

we have configured a GIT repository couple of months ago and the repository still has not started scanning. 
When testing the connection we get the following error message:
"Fisheye is using '/usr/bin/ssh' to authenticate with SSH authenticated repositories.

Error testing connection.
Error talking to repository:

ssh: Could not resolve hostname git-upload-pack: Name or service not known
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScmConfig.testConnection(GitScmConfig.java:143)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.RepositoryConfig.testConnection(RepositoryConfig.java:444)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.admin.impl.DefaultRepositoryAdminService.testConnectionFor(DefaultRepositoryAdminService.java:553)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

Connection failed."


Could you please explain us the error message? 

Thanks in advance,
Tamas Szitnyai

fields.summary: Showing the UPM admin log can't be shown, if it contains entries made by the admin password user

fields.description: I recently upgraded to Fisheye 3.2. When I go to Admin > Repository Settings > Repositories, the page says "Loading" and stops. Nothing else happens. One of my repositories is marked as stopped and I can't seem to figure out how to restart it.
fields.summary: Fisheye 3.2

fields.description:
Not-entirely reproducible, but in some cases if the branch head contains non-ascii characters the output of 'git branch' will not be parsed correctly and the branch won't be indexed at all.

Related to non utf-8 file.encoding, but at least one customer could reproduce it with utf-8 encoding set.
fields.summary: Git branch heads with non-ascii characters in commit message not parsed properly in some cases

fields.description:
This issue can be found in Func test runs on branches default and 3.1. It is NOT found in the logs for 3.0.

h3. Version and data
Reproduced on default, commit: b2223f6829c262fbd4b768b853ef5860bab311c2
Reproduced on stable 3.1.5

SVN version: bundled SVNkit, see screenshot.

Using the checkstyle repo found in FE-Hg:
/Users/sbirgisson/Development/fecru/test/svnrepos/checkstyle

1. Application run with ant debug
2. Add checkstyle svn repo
3. Wait for indexing, does not have to complete, but wait for branches to show in UI
4. Browse checkstyle branch and look at source for build.xml

fields.description:
In reference to FE-3253 when SVN operations timeout Fisheye appears to go into a loop of:

# Execute SVN command
# Wait to complete
# Timeout
# Pause for a bit
# Goto 1

When faced with a SVN operation that takes permanently longer than <insert timeout value here> after a few tries it would be good if the repository was put into (potentially) a stopped state so that it stops attempting to conduct an operation which can not possibly complete (& it should know this since it's already tried x times)

At this point the application should inform a fisheye-administrator who should then investigate how long the operation may actually take & then take the appropriate action to extend the timeout value or reconsider the position of the repository if it's located too far away to be effective.

At the moment without specific vigilance & intervention we've noticed that Fisheye will continue to try forever & with each iteration it appears to consume more heap space until eventually Fisheye runs out of memory.

Given that there are limited indexing threads (though definable) we consider it important to know if the repo you've just configured will actually never be able to index to a natural conclusion
fields.summary: When SVN operations timeout after x tries application administrators should be notified

fields.description:
Fusheye/Crucible 3.1.5
Git 1.8.3
Windows 2008 server

When running an index on a repository that contains a mailmap in the base directory the following error occurs:
{panel}
Repository index failed due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: While executing: "c:\Program Files (x86)\git\bin\git.exe whatchanged --always --reverse --date-order -m --no-abbrev --no-renames a4275f035929684c1089a05d4459827a5c351e9c --pretty=format:C:%H%nP:%P%nA:%aN%nE:%aE%nR:%cN%nF:%cE%nD:%at%nS:%s%nB:%b%n@@fe_body_end@@ " in [E:\Crucible-CreditSolve\var\cache\CKTest\clone] com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 255
{panel}

If the .mailmap is removed the repository indexes as expected.

I have created a branch new clone from our central repository, restarted the server, set the mailmap.file in the git config - all to no avail
fields.summary: Indexing a Git repository that has a .mailmap file fails

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in FishEye which allowed unauthenticated users to commit actions on behalf of any other authorised user. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to your FishEye web interface. 

FishEye server is only vulnerable if it has been configured to be a part of an Application link with Trusted Applications authentication.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of FishEye up to and including 3.1.5. It has been fixed in 3.2.0, 3.1.6 and 2.10.8.

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Fisheye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2014-02-26].
fields.summary: Privilege escalation

fields.description: Hi there.  We are planning to upgrade to Mercurial 2.8.  Does FishEye 3.1 supports Mercurial 2.8?  Currently we are running with FishEye 2.9 and Mercurial 2.0.  Can we run FishEye 2.9 with Mercurial 2.8?  Which version of Mercurial is recommended for FishEye 3.1?  Thank you.
fields.summary: FishEye 3.1 supports Mercurial 2.8?

fields.description:
We should provide a way for customers to configure two timeouts available in the SMTP mail transport:
{code}
mail.smtp.connectiontimeout
mail.smtp.timeout
{code}
Both values default to infinite (i.e. no timeout). 

In the event of a problem, the lack of a timeout can hang the WatchChecker and Notification Manager.
fields.summary: There is no way to specify timeouts on FishEye's SMTP connection

fields.description:
I have committed code in CVS, and used this commit message:
{noformat}
All dates removed except شبكة
{noformat}
Here is the output of the {{cvs log}} command:
!Commit.png!

I've configured {{FISHEYE_OPTS=-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8}}, and I've also made sure that {{UTF-8}} is selected in {{SCM Details > CVS Connection Details}}. I've restarted FishEye after configuring both of these settings, but FishEye is still not displaying this commit message correctly:
!UI.png!
fields.summary: Fisheye not displaying unicode characters from CVS Repo

fields.description:
It would be great if it were possible to:

* Create a scheduled downtime banner/message on all pages, not only to have a plain text message [in the front page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Customizing+the+front+page].
* Send this scheduled downtime notification to all users, or to specific users, or to a mail list (probable issues related to having a mail list: FE-663, CRUC-1625).
fields.summary: Scheduled downtime notification

fields.description:
In 3.1 and lower, FishEye will not index any @ symbols when indexing content and diff text.

The @ symbol is used in Java for annotations, so should be included as punctuation.
fields.summary: Allow searching content and diffs containing the @ symbol

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
You have an include path defined for your comparably large repository. This is causing large numbers of directly adjacent changesets in your repository not to be indexed. When looking up a parent changesets, the un-indexed changesets need to be skipped, and the current implementation does that recursively.

	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent(CommonChangeSetDAO.java:654)
{noformat}

*Background*
{{CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent}} calls itself recursively if the changeset that it has been called on does not have a parent that is recorded.  This will happen if that entire changeset is excluded due to include/exclude paths.

If enough consecutive changesets are excluded this can cause a stack overflow.

This method should be rewritten as a loop.

*Workaround*
Remove the include path from the global defaults and apply them on a per-repository basis instead.
fields.summary: CommonChangeSetDAO.resolveParent can Stack Overflow on a large repository

fields.description:
I am trying to understand the output of the Code Metrics report, but I am having a hard time.

What's the difference between "Top Committers – By Revision" and "Top Committers – By Commit"? Conceptually speaking, aren't "Revisions" the same as "Commits"?

I had this being displayed:
* "Top Committers – By Revision" showing 29 for my committer
* "Top Committers – By Commit" showing 30 for my committer

Then I (changed source code & committed) x2, and this was the impact:
* "Top Committers – By Revision" still showed 29 for my committer
* "Top Committers – By Commit" now showing *32* for my committer

The [Code Metrics Report documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Charts#FishEyeCharts-CodeMetrics] only contains screenshots, which are not really helpful.
fields.summary: Improve Code Metrics Report output explanation

fields.description:
In many cases, certain tasks in FishEye are better executed after business hours, when performance/normal functions are not impacted. One of such tasks is a full reindex of a repository. It would make sense to have a scheduler (as in Confluence for example), where you could queue these tasks for a specific time.

It can be worked around by scheduling the job via {{fisheyectl}} in cron/windows scheduler, but it would be convenient not to rely on any external tools for such a task.
fields.summary: Scheduler for FishEye

fields.description:
After a clean installation of FishEye/Crucible 3.1.4, I cannot migrate to Oracle.  I've created an Oracle user with full privileges but the migration fails (through the UI and CLI) with the following error:

2013-10-30 17:32:16,572 ERROR - Unable to connect to Oracle database jdbc:oracle:thin:@XXXXX:1521:XXXX: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00942: table or view does not exist

After turning on auditing in Oracle I've discovered that the migration is looking for the CRU_VERSION table which doesn't exist since this is a new user with no tables created.  Please let me know if I'm missing a step here.
fields.summary: Cannot migrate from hsqldb to Oracle

fields.description:
Seems like a drawback introduced by optimisation FE-4742.  When customer overrides crowd cookie name in Crowd and forgets to update cookie.tokenkey property in FishEye, Fisheye would not be able to authenticate the user.  This problem is difficult to investigate as most likely requires intensive communication with the customer.  

Related support issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-12825.

Few proposal to reduce support traffic and improve user experience:
 * when CrowdAuth determines the user is not logged in, could perhaps revert to old way of retrieving cookie name from crowd and ensuring Fisheye's configured token name is the same.   
 * if we are worried the above could generate too much traffic on negative authentications, this check could be throttled to 1 check per hour or so
 * when setting up crowd server in FishEye, FishEye could retrieve the token name and store it in local properties if different from default
 * Fisheye could show token name in the admin screen so it would be easier to determine if the names are different in crowd and fisheye
 * token name could be compared on each crowd synchronisation and mismatch could be logged as a warning
 * or perhaps FishEye could offer a function to check token name explicitely in the admin section
fields.summary: CrowdAuth gets confused when non default crowd cookie token name is set up in crowd

It appears to use an <aside> tag that appears to be unsupported on IE8.
fields.summary: FishEye main page right column does not render on IE8

fields.description:
Creating a new branch in a SVN repository makes impossible to diff 2 revisions of a file commited in a different branch than the new one.

For example, after creating and checking out a branch named "trunk_copy", the revisions for a file that were made in the branch "trunk" can't be differed. FishEye shows the message "Could not resolve revisions xx and xx".

I attached a video reproducing the issue, as a log.
fields.summary: Creating a new branch using SVN makes impossible to make diff between old revisions

fields.description: The regex used to extract the diff file name does not correctly handle the backslash escaped quotes within the directory names
fields.summary: Git files with double quotes in the dir name are not processed correctly

fields.description:
As a developer, I would like to be able to create reviews based on Stash pull requests, in order to use Crucible's reviewing functionality against Stash based code.

Creating reviews based on changesets means that it's hard to ensure that what is reviewed and what is merged is exactly the same. As branches are updated, I would like the relevant changesets to be added to the review accordingly.

Integration with Stash would be great (i.e. for approving/declining the merge), but not crucial.
fields.summary: Create reviews based on Stash pull requests

fields.description:
Reindexing takes a very long time for our repositories.  (It has run all weekend and is still indexing on Monday morning.)

It would be helpful to have a feature that would allow us to reindex a specific changeset or range of changesets (by date, commit number, branch, etc.) so that we don't have to reindex the entire repository any time a user edits a commit message.
fields.summary: Reindex a specific changeset

fields.description:
The JIRA Fisheye plugin (JFP) doesn't appear to be URL encoding the # character correctly in links it displays with the "Source" tab of a JIRA issue.

For instance, the link that it is providing for an issue is:
https://FISHEYE/viewrep/repoA/trunk/C#/path/inside/repo/file.cs#r1111

Whereas the correct link should be more like:
https://FISHEYE/viewrep/repoA/trunk/C%23/path/inside/repo/file.cs#r1111

The link supplied in the "Source" tab results in the "Bad link" error in Fisheye.
fields.summary: JFP: JIRA Fisheye plugin not encoding # character correctly in "Source" tab links

fields.description:
When I try to access the "Manage Add-ons" I get this message:

_This version of FishEye and Crucible is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear._

I've just updated to FECRU 3.1.4 this morning, I could access the "Manage Add-ons" page normally before the upgrade.

UPM version is 2.13.3. I can not see any errors in the log file.
fields.summary: UPM does not recognize FECRU 3.1.4

fields.description:
In order to help to make searching for terms with the browser more effective let's investigate how much we can bump up the number of lines fetched per page during progressive rendering of source files.

We need to take in account the impact that this change would have on large instances where a large number of users can look at source files at the same time.
fields.summary: Increase the number of lines fetched for progressive rendering
SVN authentication not working correctly

fields.summary: ssh process hanging

fields.description:
In config.xml <svn> tag has an 'initial-import' parameter which is ignored by the new pipeline index process. This process always does initial import if 'start-rev' is set.

We should restore such functionality if it's possible or at least remove it from configuration screen and from documentation.
fields.summary: New pipeline index ignoring initial-import setting from svn configuration

fields.description:
While the search feature in fisheye works great for finding a file containing the content you are looking at, actually finding that content inside the file is hard.  Using the browser's search page content function isn't reliable, (I assume this is because Fisheye is using some kind of virtual scroll function).  The search will often report zero instances found, and you have to scroll the file to the bottom and search again to get it to actually find the text you are looking for.

What would be very nice would be if Fisheye would highlight the search terms in the file contents, so if I searched for the string "print" and then selected one of the content matches, I would see each instance of "print" in that file highlighted.  Also, it would be nice if there the Quick Search box was able to search the contents of the source file you are currently looking at.
fields.summary: Search on browse file page

The following WARNING is reported if a Crucible standalone instance is started up that previously had both Fisheye and Crucible:
{noformat}
2013-10-12 17:28:08,874 WARN  [main ] fisheye DefaultRepositoryManager-runRepositories - Problem starting repository 
com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Current repository index for "<Repo Name>" is not compatible with your license, please re-index.
{noformat}
This message should be changed to an ERROR as it prevents Crucible to use the repositories in their current state.
The message should also be made more descriptive to include the reason for the error, i.e. they are running as Crucible Standalone and now need to re-index the repositories as they were originally indexed using both Fisheye and Crucible licenses.
fields.summary: Change logging level from WARN to ERROR if starting up as Crucible standalone with old repo indexes

fields.description:
In some cases FishEye will show the "XX seconds ago" message in the "Updates" column in the repository list page wrapped in 3 lines:

!http://content.screencast.com/users/FelipeKraemer/folders/Jing/media/dd65f89a-39cd-4869-83c1-ab1ec2d70444/00000038.png!

If someone has a lot of repositories, and if each repository is showing this message, this message will consume a lot of space in the web interface.

It is fine to show a bigger message with multiple lines if there is an indexing problem or something like that, but if there aren't any problems and the repository indexes are updated, that message could be shorter.

If the message was shorter, or if the columns of the repository list page could be resized, this would make the repository list page much more clear, and it would list more repositories per page.
fields.summary: Improvements in the repository list page in FishEye Administration

fields.description:
*Scenario/symptoms*
- You want to [specify a single IP bind|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+the+FishEye+web+server] for FishEye, instead of listening on all available addresses under Windows, but FishEye will bind to a different address than the one specified in the configuration.
- Your network interface has multiple addresses defined and FishEye will only bind to the primary (first) address of that interface if any other IP on that interface is specified.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a second IP address to the existing interface: [http://www.oclc.org/support/services/ezproxy/documentation/technote/2w.en.html]
# Open FishEye on both configured IPs in a browser, while having only the port specified in HTTP bind (example: {{:8060}})
# _Result: FishEye works on both IPs, as expected_
# Configure FishEye to bind to the second IP address that was added (example: {{192.168.1.5:8060}}, while the first IP is 192.168.1.2)
# Restart FishEye for the settings to be picked up
# Once again, open FishEye on both configured IPs in a browser
# _Result: FishEye listens only on the first IP (in the example above 192.168.1.2), however the second was defined (in the example 192.168.1.5)_

*Workaround*
Reconfigure the network interface so that the desired IP will be the primary (first) address on that interface.

*Notes*
The same scenario does not happen under Unix/Linux.
fields.summary: FishEye does not bind to the IP specified under Windows

fields.description:
Allow SSL cipher suites to be configured, preferably in the administration panel but at a minimum by editing the config.xml.  Currently we are relying on the default cipher suites for jetty which includes some outdated ones that are considered insecure these days.

See [configuring cipher suites|http://wiki.eclipse.org/Jetty/Howto/CipherSuites]

It looks like a change needs to be made in com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WebServer, where we set up the SslContextFactory.  We need to call setIncludeCipherSuites to provide a list of cipher suites.
fields.summary: SSL Cipher suites are not configurable

fields.description:
When restoring an OnDemand fisheye backup into a Fisheye 3.1.3 installation on a new server, fisheyectl.sh is not able to find the postgresql driver. 
The administration interface can successfully test a connection to the database. 

Followed these steps:
# Obtain a backup of Fisheye/Crucible from OnDemand, unzip and change filepaths to point to my svn directory.
# Create a postgresql database.
{noformat}
postgres@svn:/var/fisheye$ psql
psql (9.1.9)
Type "help" for help.

postgres=# create user fisheye password 'fisheye';
CREATE ROLE
postgres=# create database fisheye encoding 'UTF-8' OWNER fisheye;
CREATE DATABASE
postgres=# grant all on database fisheye to fisheye;
GRANT
postgres=#
{noformat}
# Import the OnDemand backup using the following command line
{noformat}
fisheye@svn:~/fecru-3.1.3/bin$ ./fisheyectl.sh restore --file /home/fisheye/FeCru-backup-20130916.zip --dbtype postgresql --jdbcurl jdbc://postgresql://localhost:5432/fisheye --username fisheye --password fisheye --sql --force
{noformat}
# Observe the restore is unable to find the driver.
{noformat}
fisheye@svn:~/fecru-3.1.3/bin$ ./fisheyectl.sh restore --file /home/fisheye/FeCru-backup-20130916.zip --dbtype postgresql --jdbcurl jdbc://postgresql://localhost:5432/fisheye --username fisheye --password fisheye --sql --force
INFO  - Using log4j configuration file: /home/fisheye/fecru-3.1.3/log4j-client.xml
INFO  - FishEye arguments: [--file, /home/fisheye/FeCru-backup-20130916.zip, --dbtype, postgresql, --jdbcurl, jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye, --username, fisheye, --password, fisheye, --sql, --force, --driver-source, user]
Starting Spring Context...
WARN  - Couldn't save config file - not a file.
INFO  - Refreshing com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore$RestoreApplicationContext@7f636e4e: startup date [Thu Sep 26 10:57:29 CST 2013]; root of context hierarchy
INFO  - Starting plugin system...
INFO  - Plugin system started.
Spring Context started
ERROR - Unable to connect to PostgreSQL database jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye
Cannot open target database at: jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye (Unable to connect to PostgreSQL database jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc://postgresql://localhost/fisheye)
INFO  - Closing com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore$RestoreApplicationContext@7f636e4e: startup date [Thu Sep 26 10:57:29 CST 2013]; root of context hierarchy
INFO  - *** application context closed ***
fisheye@svn:~/fecru-3.1.3/bin$
{noformat}

I have also tried specifying the JDBC class directly with "--driver org.postgresql.Driver", and the --driver-source as "bundled" or "user". I have copied the JDBC postgresql driver into my FISHEYE_INST/lib directory. 

{noformat}
fisheye@svn:/var/fisheye/lib$ ll
total 1308
drwxrwxr-x  2 fisheye fisheye   4096 Sep 26 10:43 ./
drwxr-xr-x 12 fisheye fisheye   4096 Sep 26 10:51 ../
-rw-r--r--  1 fisheye fisheye 855948 Sep 23 12:16 mysql-connector-java-5.1.26-bin.jar
-rw-r--r--  1 fisheye fisheye 472831 Sep 26 10:43 postgresql-8.4-701.jdbc3.jar
{noformat}

I get the same error when I try with a mysql database.
